text_paragraphs: Information Note on the Court’s case-law No.
February 1991
Viezzer v. Italy - 12598/86
Judgment 19.2.1991
Article 6
Article 6-1
Reasonable time
Length of criminal proceedings: violation

[This summary is extracted from the Court’s official reports (Series A or Reports of Judgments and Decisions). Its formatting and structure may therefore differ from the Case-Law Information Note summaries.]
I.	ARTICLE 6 § 1 OF THE CONVENTION ("reasonable time")
A.	Period to be taken into consideration
Proceedings instituted more than nine and a half years previously and still pending.
B.	Applicable criteria
Reasonableness of length of proceedings: to be assessed in the light of the particular circumstance of the case, which in this instance called for overall assessment.
Investigation was of some complexity, but applicant did nothing to slow it down.
Conclusion: violation (unanimously).
II.	ARTICLE 50 OF THE CONVENTION
Damage: sum awarded for non-pecuniary damage.
Lawyer's fees and expenses before the Court: reimbursed.
Conclusion: respondent State to pay specified sums to the applicant (unanimously).
